com.kii.thing_if

Class ThingIFAPI

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.kii.thing_if.ThingIFAPI

  • public class ThingIFAPI
extends java.lang.Object
    ThingIFAPI represent an API instance to access Thing-IF APIs for a specified target.

    • Method Detail

      • loadFromStoredInstance

        @NonNull
public static ThingIFAPI loadFromStoredInstance(@NonNull
                                                         android.content.Context context)
                                                  throws StoredInstanceNotFoundException,
                                                         UnloadableInstanceVersionException
        Try to load the instance of ThingIFAPI using stored serialized instance.
        Instance is automatically saved when following methods are called.
        onboardWithThingID(String, String), onboardWithVendorThingID(String, String), copyWithTarget(Target, String) and installPush(java.lang.String, com.kii.thing_if.PushBackend) has been successfully completed.
        (When copyWithTarget(Target, String) is called, only the copied instance is saved.)

        If the ThingIFAPI instance is build without the tag, all instance is saved in same place and overwritten when the instance is saved.

        If the ThingIFAPI instance is build with the tag(optional), tag is used as key to distinguish the storage area to save the instance. This would be useful to saving multiple instance. You need specify tag to load the instance by the api. When you catch exceptions, please call onboard methods for saving or updating serialized instance.
        Parameters:
        context - context
        Returns:
        ThingIFAPI instance.
        Throws:
        StoredInstanceNotFoundException - when the instance has not stored yet.
        UnloadableInstanceVersionException - when the instance couldn't be loaded.

      • loadFromStoredInstance

        @NonNull
public static ThingIFAPI loadFromStoredInstance(@NonNull
                                                         android.content.Context context,
                                                         java.lang.String tag)
                                                  throws StoredInstanceNotFoundException,
                                                         UnloadableInstanceVersionException
        Try to load the instance of ThingIFAPI using stored serialized instance.
        For details please refer to the loadFromStoredInstance(Context) document.
        Parameters:
        context - context
        tag - specified when the ThingIFAPI has been built.
        Returns:
        ThingIFAPI instance.
        Throws:
        StoredInstanceNotFoundException - when the instance has not stored yet.
        UnloadableInstanceVersionException - when the instance couldn't be loaded.

      • onboardWithVendorThingID

        @NonNull
 @WorkerThread
public Target onboardWithVendorThingID(@NonNull
                                                               java.lang.String vendorThingID,
                                                               @NonNull
                                                               java.lang.String thingPassword)
                                                        throws ThingIFException
        On board IoT Cloud with the specified vendor thing ID. Specified thing will be owned by owner who is specified IoT Cloud prepares communication channel to the target. If you are using a gateway, you need to use onboardEndNodeWithGateway(PendingEndNode, String) instead.
        Parameters:
        vendorThingID - Thing ID given by vendor. Must be specified.
        thingPassword - Thing Password given by vendor. Must be specified.
        Returns:
        Target instance can be used to operate target, manage resources of the target.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown when this instance is already onboarded.
        ThingIFException - Thrown when failed to connect IoT Cloud Server.
        ThingIFRestException - Thrown when server returns error response.

      • onboardWithVendorThingID

        @NonNull
 @WorkerThread
public Target onboardWithVendorThingID(@NonNull
                                                               java.lang.String vendorThingID,
                                                               @NonNull
                                                               java.lang.String thingPassword,
                                                               @Nullable
                                                               OnboardWithVendorThingIDOptions options)
                                                        throws ThingIFException
        On board IoT Cloud with the specified vendor thing ID. Specified thing will be owned by owner who is specified IoT Cloud prepares communication channel to the target. If you are using a gateway, you need to use onboardEndNodeWithGateway(PendingEndNode, String) instead.
        Parameters:
        vendorThingID - Thing ID given by vendor. Must be specified.
        thingPassword - Thing Password given by vendor. Must be specified.
        options - optional parameters inside.
        Returns:
        Target instance can be used to operate target, manage resources of the target.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown when this instance is already onboarded.
        ThingIFException - Thrown when failed to connect IoT Cloud Server.
        ThingIFRestException - Thrown when server returns error response.

      • onboardWithThingID

        @NonNull
 @WorkerThread
public Target onboardWithThingID(@NonNull
                                                         java.lang.String thingID,
                                                         @NonNull
                                                         java.lang.String thingPassword)
                                                  throws ThingIFException
        On board IoT Cloud with the specified thing ID. When you are sure that the on boarding process has been done, this method is more convenient than onboardWithThingID(String, String, OnboardWithThingIDOptions). If you are using a gateway, you need to use onboardEndNodeWithGateway(PendingEndNode, String) instead.
        Parameters:
        thingID - Thing ID given by IoT Cloud. Must be specified.
        thingPassword - Thing password given by vendor. Must be specified.
        Returns:
        Target instance can be used to operate target, manage resources of the target.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown when this instance is already onboarded.
        ThingIFException - Thrown when failed to connect IoT Cloud Server.
        ThingIFRestException - Thrown when server returns error response.

                                                         java.lang.String thingPassword,
                                                         @Nullable
                                                         OnboardWithThingIDOptions options)
                                                  throws ThingIFException
        On board IoT Cloud with the specified thing ID. When you are sure that the on boarding process has been done, this method is more convenient than If you are using a gateway, you need to use onboardEndNodeWithGateway(PendingEndNode, String) instead.
        Parameters:
        thingID - Thing ID given by IoT Cloud. Must be specified.
        thingPassword - Thing password given by vendor. Must be specified.
        options - optional parameters inside.
        Returns:
        Target instance can be used to operate target, manage resources of the target.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown when this instance is already onboarded.
        ThingIFException - Thrown when failed to connect IoT Cloud Server.

      • onboardEndNodeWithGateway

        @NonNull
 @WorkerThread
public EndNode onboardEndNodeWithGateway(@NonNull
                                                                 PendingEndNode pendingEndNode,
                                                                 @NonNull
                                                                 java.lang.String endnodePassword)
                                                          throws ThingIFException
        Endpoints execute onboarding for the thing and merge MQTT channel to the gateway. Thing act as Gateway is already registered and marked as Gateway.
        Parameters:
        pendingEndNode - Pending endnode
        endnodePassword - Password of the End Node
        Returns:
        Target instance can be used to operate target, manage resources of the target.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown when this instance is already onboarded.
        ThingIFException - Thrown when failed to connect IoT Cloud Server.
        ThingIFRestException - Thrown when server returns error response.

      • onboarded

        public boolean onboarded()
        Checks whether on boarding is done.
        Returns:
        true if done, otherwise false.

      • installPush

        @NonNull
 @WorkerThread
public java.lang.String installPush(@Nullable
                                                            java.lang.String deviceToken,
                                                            @NonNull
                                                            PushBackend pushBackend)
                                                     throws ThingIFException
        Install push notification to receive notification from IoT Cloud. This will install on production environment. IoT Cloud will send notification when the Target replies to the Command. Application can receive the notification and check the result of Command fired by Application or registered Trigger. After installation is done Installation ID is managed in this class.
        Parameters:
        deviceToken - for GCM, specify token obtained by InstanceID.getToken(). for JPUSH, specify id obtained by JPushInterface.getUdid().
        pushBackend - Specify backend to use.
        Returns:
        Installation ID used in IoT Cloud.
        Throws:
        ThingIFException - Thrown when failed to connect IoT Cloud Server.
        ThingIFRestException - Thrown when server returns error response.
        See Also:
        for development/production environment installation.

      • installPush

        @NonNull
 @WorkerThread
public java.lang.String installPush(@Nullable
                                                            java.lang.String deviceToken,
                                                            @NonNull
                                                            PushBackend pushBackend,
                                                            boolean development)
                                                     throws ThingIFException
        Install push notification to receive notification from IoT Cloud. IoT Cloud will send notification when the Target replies to the Command. Application can receive the notification and check the result of Command fired by Application or registered Trigger. After installation is done Installation ID is managed in this class.
        Parameters:
        deviceToken - for GCM, specify token obtained by InstanceID.getToken(). for JPUSH, specify id obtained by JPushInterface.getUdid().
        pushBackend - Specify backend to use.
        development - Specify development flag to use. Indicates if the installation is for development or production environment.
        Returns:
        Installation ID used in IoT Cloud.
        Throws:
        ThingIFException - Thrown when failed to connect IoT Cloud Server.
        ThingIFRestException - Thrown when server returns error response.

      • getInstallationID

        @Nullable
public java.lang.String getInstallationID()
        Get installationID if the push is already installed. null will be returned if the push installation has not been done.
        Returns:
        Installation ID used in IoT Cloud.

      • uninstallPush

        @NonNull
 @WorkerThread
public void uninstallPush(@NonNull
                                                  java.lang.String installationID)
                                           throws ThingIFException
        Uninstall push notification. After done, notification from IoT Cloud won't be notified.
        Parameters:
        installationID - installation ID returned from installPush(String, PushBackend) if null is specified, value obtained by getInstallationID() is used.
        Throws:
        ThingIFException - Thrown when failed to connect IoT Cloud Server.
        ThingIFRestException - Thrown when server returns error response.

      • postNewCommand

        @NonNull
 @WorkerThread
public Command postNewCommand(@NonNull
                                                      CommandForm form)
                                               throws ThingIFException
        Post new command to IoT Cloud. Command will be delivered to specified target and result will be notified through push notification.
        Parameters:
        form - form of command. It contains name of schema, version of schema, list of actions etc.
        Returns:
        Created Command instance. At this time, Command is delivered to the target Asynchronously and may not finished. Actual Result will be delivered through push notification or you can check the latest status of the command by calling getCommand(java.lang.String).
        Throws:
        ThingIFException - Thrown when failed to connect IoT Cloud Server.
        ThingIFRestException - Thrown when server returns error response.

      • getCommand

        @NonNull
 @WorkerThread
public Command getCommand(@NonNull
                                                  java.lang.String commandID)
                                           throws ThingIFException
        Get specified command.
        Parameters:
        commandID - ID of the command to obtain. ID is present in the instance returned by postNewCommand(com.kii.thing_if.command.CommandForm) and can be obtained by Command.getCommandID()
        Returns:
        Command instance.
        Throws:
        ThingIFException - Thrown when failed to connect IoT Cloud Server.
        ThingIFRestException - Thrown when server returns error response.

      • listCommands

        @NonNull
public android.util.Pair<java.util.List<Command>,java.lang.String> listCommands(int bestEffortLimit,
                                                                                         @Nullable
                                                                                         java.lang.String paginationKey)
                                                                                  throws ThingIFException
        List Commands in the specified Target.
        Parameters:
        bestEffortLimit - Maximum number of the Commands in the response. if the value is <= 0, default limit internally defined is applied. Meaning of 'bestEffort' is if the specified limit is greater than default limit, default limit is applied.
        paginationKey - Used to get the next page of previously obtained. If there is further page to obtain, this method returns paginationKey as the 2nd element of pair. Applying this key to the argument results continue to get the result from the next page.
        Returns:
        1st Element is Commands belongs to the Target. 2nd element is paginationKey if there is next page to be obtained.
        Throws:
        ThingIFException - Thrown when failed to connect IoT Cloud Server.
        ThingIFRestException - Thrown when server returns error response.

      • postNewTrigger

        @NonNull
 @WorkerThread
public Trigger postNewTrigger(@NonNull
                                                      TriggeredCommandForm form,
                                                      @NonNull
                                                      Predicate predicate,
                                                      @Nullable
                                                      TriggerOptions options)
                                               throws ThingIFException
        Post new Trigger with commands to IoT Cloud.

        When thing retrieved by getTarget() of this ThingIFAPI instance meets condition described by predicate, A command registered by TriggeredCommandForm sends to thing given by TriggeredCommandForm.getTargetID().

        getTarget() instance and thing specified by TriggeredCommandForm.getTargetID() must be same owner's things.

        Parameters:
        form - Form of triggered command. It contains name of schema, version of schema, list of actions, target IDof thing etc. You can see detail of form in TriggeredCommandForm.
        predicate - Specify when the Trigger fires command.
        options - option fileds of this trigger.
        Returns:
        Instance of the Trigger registered in IoT Cloud.
        Throws:
        ThingIFException - Thrown when failed to connect IoT Cloud Server.
        ThingIFRestException - Thrown when server returns error response.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of form, predicate and options is/are null.

      • postNewTrigger

        @NonNull
 @WorkerThread
public Trigger postNewTrigger(@NonNull
                                                      TriggeredCommandForm form,
                                                      @NonNull
                                                      Predicate predicate)
                                               throws ThingIFException
        Post new Trigger with commands to IoT Cloud.

        When thing retrieved by getTarget() of this ThingIFAPI instance meets condition described by predicate, A command registered by TriggeredCommandForm sends to thing given by TriggeredCommandForm.getTargetID().

        Limited version of postNewTrigger(TriggeredCommandForm, Predicate, TriggerOptions)

        getTarget() instance and thing specified by TriggeredCommandForm.getTargetID() must be same owner's things.

        Parameters:
        form - Form of triggered command. It contains name of schema, version of schema, list of actions, target IDof thing etc. You can see detail of form in TriggeredCommandForm.
        predicate - Specify when the Trigger fires command.
        Returns:
        Instance of the Trigger registered in IoT Cloud.
        Throws:
        ThingIFException - Thrown when failed to connect IoT Cloud Server.
        ThingIFRestException - Thrown when server returns error response.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of form and predicate is/are null.

      • postNewTrigger

        @NonNull
 @WorkerThread
public Trigger postNewTrigger(@NonNull
                                                      ServerCode serverCode,
                                                      @NonNull
                                                      Predicate predicate,
                                                      @Nullable
                                                      TriggerOptions options)
                                               throws ThingIFException
        Post new Trigger with server code to IoT Cloud.
        Parameters:
        serverCode - Specify server code you want to execute.
        predicate - Specify when the Trigger fires command.
        options - option fileds of this trigger.
        Returns:
        Instance of the Trigger registered in IoT Cloud.
        Throws:
        ThingIFException - Thrown when failed to connect IoT Cloud Server.
        ThingIFRestException - Thrown when server returns error response.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of serverCode, predicate and options is/are null.

      • postNewTrigger

        @NonNull
 @WorkerThread
public Trigger postNewTrigger(@NonNull
                                                      ServerCode serverCode,
                                                      @NonNull
                                                      Predicate predicate)
                                               throws ThingIFException
        Post new Trigger with server code to IoT Cloud.

        Limited version of postNewTrigger(ServerCode, Predicate, TriggerOptions). This method can not be set title, description and metadata of Trigger.

        Parameters:
        serverCode - Specify server code you want to execute.
        predicate - Specify when the Trigger fires command.
        Returns:
        Instance of the Trigger registered in IoT Cloud.
        Throws:
        ThingIFException - Thrown when failed to connect IoT Cloud Server.
        ThingIFRestException - Thrown when server returns error response.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of serverCode and predicate is/are null.

      • patchCommandTrigger

        @NonNull
 @WorkerThread
public Trigger patchCommandTrigger(@NonNull
                                                           java.lang.String triggerID,
                                                           @Nullable
                                                           TriggeredCommandForm form,
                                                           @Nullable
                                                           Predicate predicate,
                                                           @Nullable
                                                           TriggerOptions options)
                                                    throws ThingIFException
        Apply patch to registered trigger. Modify registered trigger with specified patch.
        Parameters:
        triggerID - ID of the trigger to apply patch.
        form - Form of triggered command. It contains name of schema, version of schema, list of actions, target IDof thing etc. You can see detail of form in TriggeredCommandForm.
        predicate - Modified predicate.
        options - option fileds of this trigger.
        Returns:
        Updated trigger instance.
        Throws:
        ThingIFException - Thrown when failed to connect IoT Cloud Server.
        ThingIFRestException - Thrown when server returns error response.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - This exception is thrown if one or more following conditions are met.
        • triggerID is null or empty string.
        • All of form, predicate and options are null.

      • patchCommandTrigger

        @NonNull
 @WorkerThread
public Trigger patchCommandTrigger(@NonNull
                                                           java.lang.String triggerID,
                                                           @Nullable
                                                           TriggeredCommandForm form,
                                                           @Nullable
                                                           Predicate predicate)
                                                    throws ThingIFException
        Apply patch to registered trigger. Modify registered trigger with specified patch.

        Limited version of patchCommandTrigger(String, TriggeredCommandForm, Predicate, TriggerOptions)

        Parameters:
        triggerID - ID of the trigger to apply patch.
        form - Form of triggered command. It contains name of schema, version of schema, list of actions, target IDof thing etc. You can see detail of form in TriggeredCommandForm.
        predicate - Modified predicate.
        Returns:
        Updated trigger instance.
        Throws:
        ThingIFException - Thrown when failed to connect IoT Cloud Server.
        ThingIFRestException - Thrown when server returns error response.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - This exception is thrown if one or more following conditions are met.
        • triggerID is null or empty string.
        • both form and predicate are null.

      • patchServerCodeTrigger

        @NonNull
 @WorkerThread
public Trigger patchServerCodeTrigger(@NonNull
                                                              java.lang.String triggerID,
                                                              @Nullable
                                                              ServerCode serverCode,
                                                              @Nullable
                                                              Predicate predicate,
                                                              @Nullable
                                                              TriggerOptions options)
                                                       throws ThingIFException
        Apply Patch to registered Trigger Modify registered Trigger with specified patch.
        Parameters:
        triggerID - ID ot the Trigger to apply patch
        serverCode - Specify server code you want to execute.
        predicate - Modified predicate.
        options - option fileds of this trigger.
        Returns:
        Updated Trigger instance.
        Throws:
        ThingIFException - Thrown when failed to connect IoT Cloud Server.
        ThingIFRestException - Thrown when server returns error response.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - This exception is thrown if one or more following conditions are met.
        • triggerID is null or empty string.
        • all of serverCode, predicate and options are null.

      • patchServerCodeTrigger

        @NonNull
 @WorkerThread
public Trigger patchServerCodeTrigger(@NonNull
                                                              java.lang.String triggerID,
                                                              @Nullable
                                                              ServerCode serverCode,
                                                              @Nullable
                                                              Predicate predicate)
                                                       throws ThingIFException
        Apply Patch to registered Trigger Modify registered Trigger with specified patch.

        Limited version of patchServerCodeTrigger(String, ServerCode, Predicate, TriggerOptions)

        Parameters:
        triggerID - ID ot the Trigger to apply patch
        serverCode - Specify server code you want to execute. If null, predicate must not be null.
        predicate - Modified predicate. If null, serverCode must not be null.
        Returns:
        Updated Trigger instance.
        Throws:
        ThingIFException - Thrown when failed to connect IoT Cloud Server.
        ThingIFRestException - Thrown when server returns error response.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - This exception is thrown if one or more following conditions are met.
        • triggerID is null or empty string.
        • both serverCode and predicate are null.

      • enableTrigger

        @NonNull
 @WorkerThread
public Trigger enableTrigger(@NonNull
                                                     java.lang.String triggerID,
                                                     boolean enable)
                                              throws ThingIFException
        Enable/Disable registered Trigger If its already enabled(/disabled), this method won't throw Exception and behave as succeeded.
        Parameters:
        triggerID - ID of the Trigger to be enabled(/disabled).
        enable - specify whether enable of disable the Trigger.
        Returns:
        Updated Trigger Instance.
        Throws:
        ThingIFException - Thrown when failed to connect IoT Cloud Server.
        ThingIFRestException - Thrown when server returns error response.

      • listTriggeredServerCodeResults

        @NonNull
 @WorkerThread
public android.util.Pair<java.util.List<TriggeredServerCodeResult>,java.lang.String> listTriggeredServerCodeResults(@NonNull
                                                                                                                                            java.lang.String triggerID,
                                                                                                                                            int bestEffortLimit,
                                                                                                                                            @Nullable
                                                                                                                                            java.lang.String paginationKey)
                                                                                                                                     throws ThingIFException
        Retrieves list of server code results that was executed by the specified trigger. Results will be listing with order by modified date descending (latest first)
        Parameters:
        triggerID - trigger ID to retrieve server code results.
        bestEffortLimit - limit the maximum number of the results in the Response. It ensures numbers in response is equals to or less than specified number. But doesn't ensures number of the results in the response is equal to specified value.
        If the specified value <= 0, Default size of the limit is applied by IoT Cloud.
        paginationKey - If specified obtain rest of the items.
        Returns:
        first is list of the results and second is paginationKey returned by IoT Cloud. paginationKey is null when there is next page to be obtained. Obtained paginationKey can be used to get the rest of the items stored in the target.
        Throws:
        ThingIFException - Thrown when failed to connect IoT Cloud Server.
        ThingIFRestException - Thrown when server returns error response.

      • listTriggers

        @NonNull
 @WorkerThread
public android.util.Pair<java.util.List<Trigger>,java.lang.String> listTriggers(int bestEffortLimit,
                                                                                                        @Nullable
                                                                                                        java.lang.String paginationKey)
                                                                                                 throws ThingIFException
        List Triggers belongs to the specified Target.
        If the Schema of the Trigger included in the response does not matches with the Schema registered this ThingIfAPI instance, It won't be included in returned value.
        Parameters:
        bestEffortLimit - limit the maximum number of the Triggers in the Response. It ensures numbers in response is equals to or less than specified number. But doesn't ensures number of the Triggers in the response is equal to specified value.
        If the specified value <= 0, Default size of the limit is applied by IoT Cloud.
        paginationKey - If specified obtain rest of the items.
        Returns:
        first is list of the Triggers and second is paginationKey returned by IoT Cloud. paginationKey is null when there is next page to be obtained. Obtained paginationKey can be used to get the rest of the items stored in the target.
        Throws:
        ThingIFException - Thrown when failed to connect IoT Cloud Server.
        ThingIFRestException - Thrown when server returns error response.

      • getTargetState

        @NonNull
 @WorkerThread
public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,? extends TargetState> getTargetState()
                                                                                             throws ThingIFException
        Get the state of specified target.
        Returns:
        Map of alias and state instance. If state of target had never be updated, empty map is returned.
        Throws:
        ThingIFException - Thrown when failed to connect IoT Cloud Server.
        ThingIFRestException - Thrown when server returns error response.
        UnregisteredAliasException - Thrown when the returned response contains alias that cannot be handled.

      • getTargetState

        @NonNull
 @WorkerThread
public <S extends TargetState> S getTargetState(@NonNull
                                                                        java.lang.String alias,
                                                                        @NonNull
                                                                        java.lang.Class<S> targetStateClass)
                                                                 throws ThingIFException
        Get the State of specified alias. State will be serialized with Gson library.
        Type Parameters:
        S - Class implements TargetState interface
        Parameters:
        alias - Specify alias to get state.
        targetStateClass - Class of S.
        Returns:
        Instance of Target State.
        Throws:
        ThingIFException - Thrown when failed to connect IoT Cloud Server.
        ThingIFRestException - Thrown when server returns error response.
        java.lang.ClassCastException - Thrown when S is different with registered class for this alias.
        UnregisteredAliasException - Thrown when alias cannot be handled.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when targetStateClass is null.

      • query

        public <S extends TargetState> android.util.Pair<java.util.List<HistoryState<S>>,java.lang.String> query(@NonNull
                                                                                                         HistoryStatesQuery query,
                                                                                                         @NonNull
                                                                                                         java.lang.Class<S> targetStateClass)
                                                                                                  throws ThingIFException
        Query history states.
        Type Parameters:
        S - Type of subclass of TargetState.
        Parameters:
        query - Instance of HistoryStatesQuery.
        targetStateClass - class of S, used to verify with registered target state class for the specified alias
        Returns:
        Pair instance. First element is list of target state. Second element is next pagination key.
        Throws:
        ThingIFException - Thrown when failed to connect IoT Cloud Server.
        ThingIFRestException - Thrown when server returns error response.
        UnregisteredAliasException - Thrown when the returned response contains alias that cannot be handled.
        java.lang.ClassCastException - Thrown when targetStateClass is different with registered target state class for the specified alias.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when any of query and targetStateClass is/are null.

      • query

        @NonNull
public <S extends TargetState> java.util.List<GroupedHistoryStates<S>> query(@NonNull
                                                                                      GroupedHistoryStatesQuery query,
                                                                                      @NonNull
                                                                                      java.lang.Class<S> targetStateClass)
                                                                               throws ThingIFException
        Group history state
        Type Parameters:
        S - Type of subclass of TargetState.
        Parameters:
        query - GroupedHistoryStatesQuery instance. timeRange in query should less than 60 data grouping intervals.
        targetStateClass - class of S, used to verify with registered target state class for the specified alias
        Returns:
        List of GroupedHistoryStates instances.
        Throws:
        ThingIFException - Thrown when failed to connect IoT Cloud Server.
        ThingIFRestException - Thrown when server returns error response.
        BadRequestException - Thrown if timeRange of query is over 60 data grouping intervals.
        java.lang.ClassCastException - Thrown when targetStateClass is different with registered target class for the specified alias.

      • aggregate

        public <T extends java.lang.Number,S extends TargetState> java.util.List<AggregatedResult<T,S>> aggregate(@NonNull
                                                                                                          GroupedHistoryStatesQuery groupedQuery,
                                                                                                          @NonNull
                                                                                                          Aggregation aggregation,
                                                                                                          @NonNull
                                                                                                          java.lang.Class<S> targetStateClass,
                                                                                                          @NonNull
                                                                                                          java.lang.Class<T> valueClass)
                                                                                                   throws ThingIFException
        Aggregate history states
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type of AggregatedResult.value.
        S - Type of subclass of TargetState.
        Parameters:
        groupedQuery - GroupedHistoryStatesQuery instance. timeRange in query should less than 60 data grouping intervals.
        aggregation - Aggregation instance.
        targetStateClass - class of S, used to verify with registered target state class for the specified alias
        valueClass - Class of AggregatedResult.value.
        Returns:
        List of AggregatedResult instance.
        Throws:
        ThingIFException - Thrown when failed to connect IoT Cloud Server.
        ThingIFRestException - Thrown when server returns error response.
        BadRequestException - Thrown if timeRange of query is over 60 data grouping intervals.
        UnregisteredAliasException - Thrown when alias cannot be handled.
        java.lang.ClassCastException - Thrown when targetStateClass is different with registered target class for the specified alias.
